Description:
You arrive at a strange island shaped like a monkey. 

At the base of the monkey’s head, there are several Loa statues, but among them are three broken ones that you can barely distinguish, though they seem to represent a lion, a deer, and an eagle. 

You look around and find some materials and tools, but there are only enough to repair one of the statues.
DescriptionAction: Would you like to repair one of the statues?

    "SSCRewardHealthPercent": 0.0,
    "SSCRewardText": "After you finish repairing the lion statue, a male voice speaks from it and tells you the story of the lion.\n\nHe faced a cruel rebellion against the old Loa ways and was a paragon of virtue and honor until the bitter end. He never asked others to do anything he wouldn't do himself and was always the first to charge the enemy. In the end, he understood that while changes can be necessary, they must always respect traditions, for, ultimately, that is all that matters.\n\nYou feel infused with the spirit of the lion.",

    "SSCRewardText": "After you finish repairing the eagle statue, a female voice emanates from it and tells you the story of the eagle. \r\n\nShe explains how she used her power and reputation to challenge the Loa’s traditions and how she was perceived as evil for doing so. However, she did not care what others thought of her because she knew her intentions were for the greater good, and in the end, that is all that matters. \r\n\nYou feel infused with the spirit of the eagle.",
